site_name.label: Site name
site_name.description: E.g. <site-name>.azurewebsites.net (can only contain alphanumeric characters and `-`)

python_version.label: Python version
python_version.description: The version of Python to run the site on

post_deployment_scripts_directory.label: Post-deployment scripts directory
post_deployment_scripts_directory.description: Relative path to the directory containing scripts that will be executed after every deployment

requirements_file_name.label: Requirements file path
requirements_file_name.description: File name of pip's requirements file

static_assets_directory.label: Static assets directory
static_assets_directory.description: Relative path to the directory containing static files that IIS will serve directly

log_file_path.label: Log file path
log_file_path.description: Absolute file path to where the log file will be written

main_module.label: Main module
main_module.description: Name of the module used to start execution of the site, e.g. `python -m <main module>`

site_type.label: Site type
site_type.description: Choose `socket` if you want access to the server's listening socket, `WSGI` for a WSGI-based site

socket_port_env_var.label: Port environment variable
socket_port_env_var.description: Name to give the environment variable which will store the listening port number (socket-based sites only)
